snippet: Jean-Claude Duvalier, known as Baby Doc, walked into a packed courtroom on Thursday and for the first time answered questions about his brutal, 15-year reign.
abstract: Jean-Claude Duvalier, former Hatian dictator known as Baby Doc and accused of bearing responsibility for deaths, torture and disappearance of hundreds of people, appears for first time in court to answer questions about his brutal 15-year reign; Duvalier's presence in court comes as surprise to many.

byline.original: By ISABEAU DOUCET and RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD
byline.contributor: Isabeau Doucet reported from Port-au-Prince, and Randal C. Archibold from Mexico City.

lead_paragraph: Jean-Claude Duvalier, known as Baby Doc, walked into a packed courtroom on Thursday and for the first time answered questions about his brutal, 15-year reign.

headline.seo: Duvalier Faces Questions in Court About His Reign in Haiti
headline.main: Haitian Ex-Dictator Is Questioned in Court Over Reign
headline.print_headline: Haitian Ex-Dictator Is Questioned in Court Over Reign

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
